readability_reflection: Interpolation, you can fill in everything in the context of the string rather than having to switch modes back and forth between reading the string and ignoring the concatenation characters.
comprehension_debugging: Some specific interpolation rules were unclear but it was way easier to see what a string should look like at a glance through interpolation rather than concatenation
preference_rationale: Interpolation. Strings are far easier to read and understand at a glance.
learning_curve: Prior experience let me to be careful with spaces when parsing concatenated strings. Otherwise it's just a matter of having experience reading both types over years of programming.
suggestions_improvement: Any good IDE should do syntax highlighting that'll call out interpolated strings, which really improves the experience.
